span.p: Schools are foundational to the infrastructure of our communities and we appreciate our staff‘s commitment to student and family well being. On this page, you will find an evolving collection of resources to help families during the COVID-19 outbreak.

a.title: Go to comments for Website Learning Resources

span.h2: Student Learning and Grading Guidance From OSPI
span.p: Please click on the link below to learn more about the Student Learning and Grading Guidance put out for Washington schools by OSPI. Supt. Reykdal Explains Learning & Grading Guidance
Click here for Grading Rubric School Closure

a.title: Go to comments for Student Learning and Grading

span.p: Parent/StudentInterestMeeting:Thursday, May 7th @ 6pm in the KFHS Commons or via Zoom if social distancing is not lifted (highly recommended that both prospective and veteran squad members and a parent attend) Click here to download tryout paperwork.

a.title: Go to comments for 20-21 Cheer Try Outs

span.p: The Kettle Falls School District Office is closed to the public at this time. If you need assistance, please call our office at 509-738-6625, choose the distict office option. We will have staff available from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm Monday - Thursday. Please feel free to leave a message, we will be working from home and returning calls. You may also email Julie at jpeterson@kfschools.org.

a.title: Go to comments for District Office Hours

span.p: Paid Sick Leave and expanded family and medical leave under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA). This act requires certain employers to provide their employees with paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave for specified reasons related to COVID-19. These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020 through December 31, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for FFCRA - Employee Rights

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: KFHS Juniors are exploring the "Game of Life" in their weekly Advisory class.

a.title: Go to comments for "Game of Life"

img.alt: Family Night at the Elementary School

a.span: Family Night at the Elementary School

div.p: Families played games together and then were given a copy of the game to play at home!

a.title: Go to comments for Family Night at the Elementary School

div.p: Kettle Falls Middle School encourages students to think of Martin Luther King Jr Day as a day of service, rather than a day off.

a.title: Go to comments for Day of Service!

div.p: The Sophomore Biology class did a Liver Lab to determine the effect of temperature on an enzyme-catalyzed reaction, using the enzyme Catalase

a.title: Go to comments for Liver Lab

div.p: Mrs. Berghammer’s second-grade class has just started a new Expedition module on how fossils tell of the Earth’s changes.

a.title: Go to comments for Earth’s Changes Expedition

div.p: “The more you read the more things you know. The more that you learn, the more places you’ll go.” Dr. Seuss

a.title: Go to comments for Community Readers

div.p: Fourth-grade students, in Mrs. Edwards’ classroom, have been diving deep into rigorous math exploration during their math forums.

a.title: Go to comments for Multiplication Strategies

img.alt: Veteran’s Day at the Elementary School

a.span: Veteran’s Day at the Elementary School

div.p: On Veteran’s Day, Kettle Falls Elementary students honored the veterans in our community with a heartfelt assembly.

a.title: Go to comments for Veteran’s Day at the Elementary School

div.p: Geometry students at KFHS combined Art and Math skills to practice Slope Intercept Equations.

a.title: Go to comments for Slope Intercept Equations

div.p: Kettle Falls Middle School had the privilege of artist Annde Hurst completing a mural on the west side of the building.

a.title: Go to comments for Talented Artist Contributes to KFMS!

div.p: In Mrs. Bradeen’s second grade class, students read Jack and the Beanstalk and then were presented with a challenge.

a.title: Go to comments for Jack and the Beanstalk

div.p: The Kettle Falls Cross Country team has been doing exceptionally well this year.

a.title: Go to comments for Kettle Falls Cross Country Team

div.p: In Mrs. Mitchell's first grade class, students spent time studying tools and how they make our jobs and lives easier.

a.title: Go to comments for MAGNIFICENT ball carts!

div.p: The KFHS Math is Cool Team is off to a great start!

a.title: Go to comments for Math Is Cool

div.p: Today students participated in the Pumpkin Olympics at Kettle Falls Elementary.

a.title: Go to comments for Pumpkin Olympics

div.p: Greek Day during Homecoming Week at Kettle Falls High School didn’t deter the Juniors and Seniors in Mrs. Stewart’s Composition class from business as usual.

a.title: Go to comments for It’s All Greek To Me

img.alt: A Midsummer’s Night Dream Field Trip

a.span: A Midsummer’s Night Dream Field Trip

div.p: The new Theatrical Literature class at Kettle Falls High School received a mini-grant through Gear Up to attend a Whitworth University Theatre Department production of A Midsummer’s Night Dream at the Bing Crosby Theatre in Downtown Spokane.

a.title: Go to comments for A Midsummer’s Night Dream Field Trip

div.p: Kettle Falls High School FFA students came in on a weekend and cleaned out the compound behind the school as a service project.

a.title: Go to comments for Taking Pride in Our Area!

div.p: KFMS 7th and 8th graders worked hard the last week of school to present their projects in the school science fair.

a.title: Go to comments for America's Next Generation of Innovators

div.p: The KFMS recently hosted the Kettle Falls Spring Concert in the middle school gym.

a.title: Go to comments for The Sounds of Spring

div.p: At the end of every year the KFMS 8th graders get to enjoy a day at Silverwood Theme Park.

a.title: Go to comments for 8th Grade Silverwood Trip

div.p: KFMS students are constantly encouraged to find time to read to increase knowledge, skill and understanding through the exploration of books.

a.title: Go to comments for Students keep on rolling!

div.p: It was a "beeutiful" day at KFMS to catch and study bees.

a.title: Go to comments for Pollinator Program

div.p: Spanish 2 students are reading a book about Felipe Alou.

a.title: Go to comments for Felipe Alou

div.p: Students from KFMS and KFES met at Happy Dell park to bike to school for National Bike to School Day

a.title: Go to comments for Bike to School

div.p: KFHS Advanced Art students: Cadie Schoonover, Mya Edwards and Cierra Antione are showing great leadership by planning and expanding the existing mural in the high school hallway.

a.title: Go to comments for Start Students Brighten the Hallway

div.p: On display at the Old Apple Warehouse

a.title: Go to comments for Bee Artwork

div.p: 6th grade Math is Cool team won 2nd place in our division at the Math Classic All Star competition

a.title: Go to comments for Math is Cool - 2nd Place!

div.p: Laithes are used to manufacture very precise and accurate pieces for automotives, machinery, Robotics, or anything needing precision parts.

a.title: Go to comments for Learning How to Use Laithes

div.p: 5th graders have spent the last several months learning about the American Revolution.

a.title: Go to comments for American Revolution

div.p: KFHS Senior Girls were taken to brunch on May 1 for having a GPA of 3.0 and above

a.title: Go to comments for PEO Luncheon

div.p: Mr. Heideman's Spanish and Culture class recently celebrated Cinco de Mayo.

a.title: Go to comments for Cinco de Mayo

div.p: Mrs. Axtell and her 3rd period Environmental Science class went to the Meyers Falls Dam on April 25th and cleaned up various bottles and trash from the roadside.

a.title: Go to comments for Environmental Science

div.p: KFMS Students from Mrs. Box's 6th grade class walked to the elementary school to teach about being "Upstanders".

a.title: Go to comments for Upstanders

div.p: Junior and Seniors in Speech and Debate recently kicked off the Debate portion of the course.

a.title: Go to comments for Debate Class

div.p: 8th grade students helped spruce up Meyers Falls Dam visitor area for Build a Better World Day.

a.title: Go to comments for Community Clean Up!

div.p: Azul, rojo, rosado! Spanish 1 students learn clothing and colors by trying on clothes and talking about them.

a.title: Go to comments for Clothing and Colors!

div.p: The Kettle Falls Middle School hosted the annual Grandparent's Day luncheon.

a.title: Go to comments for Grandparent's Day Lunch

div.p: Spanish 2 students work on a logic puzzle. All clues and information are in Spanish.

a.title: Go to comments for Logic Puzzles in Spanish

div.p: The 4thgrade students at KFES were presented with an opportunity to write an essay for the Colville Veterans of Foreign Wars.

a.title: Go to comments for Essay Competition

div.p: Mrs. House’s Life Skills students are selling slushies in two flavors at lunchtime for a dollar each.

a.title: Go to comments for Mmmm....Slushy Time!

div.p: KFES honored their volunteers by inviting them to a special lunch.

a.title: Go to comments for Volunteer Lunch at Elementary School

div.p: 5th grade students from KFMS challenged their brains in the math classic.

a.title: Go to comments for Math Classic

div.p: Friday, May 10th at 3:00 PM

a.title: Go to comments for Annual Mother’s Day Plant Sale

div.p: Congratulations to the Kettle Falls High School Trap team!

a.title: Go to comments for State Trap Shoot

div.p: We are busily working on several projects across the district that we wanted to share with the community.

a.title: Go to comments for Spring Construction

div.p: Kettle Falls Middle School has talent!

a.title: Go to comments for Talent Show

div.p: Mr. Jones's 7th grade class recently practiced their writing skills with Mrs. Edwards 4th grade class.

a.title: Go to comments for Writing Skills

div.p: Physics students put their knowledge to the test and competed to build the strongest bridges out of small balsam sticks and Elmer's glue.

a.title: Go to comments for Building Bridges

div.p: We knew we could "count" on the KFMS math team doing super well!

a.title: Go to comments for Middle School Math Team
Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News
a.span: Subscribe to RSS Feed - District News

div.p: CONNECT WITH US

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.span: I create welcoming experiences that instill a sense of family.
I take responsibility and lead by example.
I generate solutions that lead to positive results we celebrate.
I contribute to the development of our bright future.

li.a: Safe Schools Training (required for all staff)

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.span: Click here for our image guidelines

div.p: Karen Krantz, outstanding teacher at Adams Elementary School in the Spokane Public Schools.

a.title: Go to comments for 101 in 101 - Karen Krantz

img.alt: 101 in 101 // Johanna Brown // Pullman High School -
img.title: 101 in 101 // Johanna Brown // Pullman High School -

span.a: 101 in 101 // Johanna Brown // Pullman High School

div.p: This project was created for North East Washington ESD 101. The goal was to open a window into the classrooms of some of the past recipients of the Teacher of the Year award. It’s called Teacher’s Voices and aimed to tell the teachers story in 101 seconds. The project was paid for by Spokane Teachers Credit Union.

a.title: Go to comments for 101 in 101 // Johanna Brown // Pullman High School

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.class: hp gb-social-icons bottom ui-clear hidden hide960 show480
